bill.constitutionalAuthorityStatementText: From the Congressional Record Online through the Government Publishing Office [www.gpo.gov]By Mrs. CHRISTENSEN:H.R. 87.Congress has the power to enact this legislation pursuantto the following:``Article IV, section 3 of the Constitution of the UnitedStates grant Congress the authority to make all needful Rulesand Regulations respecting the Territory or other Propertybelonging to the United States.''[Page H35]

item.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Public Lands and Environmental Regulation.
Referred to the House Committee on Natural Resources.

summary.text:
Castle Nugent National Historic Site Establishment Act of 2013 - Establishes the Castle Nugent National Historic Site on the island of St. Croix, U.S. Virgin Islands, as a unit of the National Park System in order to preserve, protect, and interpret a Caribbean cultural landscape spanning over 300 years of agricultural use, significant archeological resources, an extensive barrier coral reef system, and other outstanding natural features.

Authorizes the Secretary of the Interior to lease certain lands within the boundary of the Historic Site to the University of the Virgin Islands for the purpose of continuing the University's operations for breeding Senepol cattle.

bill.title: Castle Nugent National Historic Site Establishment Act of 2013

item.title: Castle Nugent National Historic Site Establishment Act of 2013
Castle Nugent National Historic Site Establishment Act of 2013
To establish the Castle Nugent National Historic Site at St. Croix, United States Virgin Islands, and for other purposes.

latestAction.text: Referred to the Subcommittee on Public Lands and Environmental Regulation.

dublinCore.dc:rights: Pursuant to Title 17 Section 105 of the United States Code, this file is not subject to copyright protection and is in the public domain.
dublinCore.dc:contributor: Congressional Research Service, Library of Congress
dublinCore.dc:description: This file contains bill summaries and statuses for federal legislation. A bill summary describes the most significant provisions of a piece of legislation and details the effects the legislative text may have on current law and federal programs. Bill summaries are authored by the Congressional Research Service (CRS) of the Library of Congress. As stated in Public Law 91-510 (2 USC 166 (d)(6)), one of the duties of CRS is "to prepare summaries and digests of bills and resolutions of a public general nature introduced in the Senate or House of Representatives". For more information, refer to the User Guide that accompanies this file.
